ground_truth: Sandra checks the mail, hoping for a letter from Edward, when a black car pulls up and two army officers get out, causing Sandra to cry out upon hearing the news. Later, Sandra hangs sheets to dry, forming a tunnel of fabric, and as she pulls a dress from the basket, she looks up and sees a shadow ripple across the white fabric. She freezes, knowing it can't be him—he's dead—and turns away, but with determination, she hangs the dress and retrieves another. Looking up again, she sees Edward himself standing before her, and gasps in disbelief, but his hand is real, so she kisses him without hesitation. Under the covers, a man's hand traces the curves of a woman's back, then she turns over in bed, waking up to Will watching her. Edward is startled as both women quickly gather plates, and Will and Edward smile, knowing the women want this to happen. Edward looks away, angry and disbelieving, as Will cleans leaves from the pool, but the pool is overgrown with algae and slime. A sudden underwater ripple startles Will, who drops the pole into the water and looks around, relieved no one saw. The doors open to reveal Sandra, Will, and Josephine staring into a storeroom, filled with unfinished projects, old products Edward sold, a roll-top desk, and metal file cabinets. Sandra makes a sound of memory while looking through a file and hands Will a yellowed telegram, which shocks him. Sandra stands and Josephine kisses Will before following her, while he re-reads the telegram in disbelief. Searching for a place to set it, he tucks it into a mechanical hand on the desk, which clamps down on it. The camera pushes in on the telegram as Edward's voice begins as a memory, where on a platform Edward pitches a new product to a crowd and kisses his pregnant wife goodbye, still in love.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Sandra inspects the correspondence, hoping for a note from Edward, when a dark automobile arrives and two military officers exit, causing Sandra to exclaim upon hearing the information. Later, Sandra hangs linens to dry, forming a passage of cloth, and as she pulls a gown from the container, she glances up and sees a silhouette undulate across the white fabric. She halts, knowing it can't be him—he's deceased—and turns away, but with resolve, she hangs the gown and retrieves another. Looking up again, she sees Edward himself standing before her, and gasps in incredulity, but his hand is genuine, so she kisses him without reluctance. Under the covers, a man's hand traces the contours of a woman's back, then she turns over in bed, waking up to Will observing her. Edward is surprised as both women quickly collect dishes, and Will and Edward smile, knowing the women desire this to occur. Edward looks away, irate and incredulous, as Will cleans foliage from the pool, but the pool is overrun with algae and slime. A sudden underwater undulation startles Will, who lets the pole fall into the water and looks around, relieved no one noticed. The doors open to reveal Sandra, Will, and Josephine staring into a storeroom, filled with unfinished undertakings, old merchandise Edward sold, a roll-top desk, and metal file cabinets. Sandra makes a sound of recollection while looking through a file and hands Will a yellowed telegram, which shocks him. Sandra stands and Josephine kisses Will before following her, while he re-reads the telegram in disbelief. Searching for a location to set it, he tucks it into a mechanical hand on the desk, which clamps down on it. The camera pushes in on the telegram as Edward's voice begins as a recollection, where on a stage Edward pitches a new merchandise to a crowd and kisses his expectant wife goodbye, still in love.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The mail is checked by Sandra, hoping for a letter from Edward, when a black car is pulled up to and two army officers get out, causing Sandra to cry out upon hearing the news. Later, sheets are hung by Sandra to dry, forming a tunnel of fabric, and as a dress is pulled from the basket by her, she looks up and sees a shadow ripple across the white fabric. She is frozen, knowing it can't be him—he's dead—and turns away, but with determination, she hangs the dress and retrieves another. Looking up again, she sees Edward himself standing before her, and gasps in disbelief, but his hand is real, so he is kissed by her without hesitation. Under the covers, the curves of a woman's back are traced by a man's hand, then she turns over in bed, waking up to see Will watching her. Both women quickly gather plates, startling Edward, and Will and Edward smile, knowing the women want this to happen. Angry and disbelieving, Edward looks away as leaves are cleaned from the pool by Will, but the pool is overgrown with algae and slime. Will is startled by a sudden underwater ripple, who drops the pole into the water and looks around, relieved no one saw. The doors are opened to reveal Sandra, Will, and Josephine staring into a storeroom, filled with unfinished projects, old products Edward had sold, a roll-top desk, and metal file cabinets. A sound of memory is made by Sandra while looking through a file and she hands Will a yellowed telegram, which shocks him. Sandra stands and Josephine kisses Will before following her, while the telegram is re-read by him in disbelief. Searching for a place to set it, he tucks it into a mechanical hand on the desk, which clamps down on it. The camera is pushed in on the telegram as Edward begins his voice as a memory, where on a platform a new product is pitched to a crowd by Edward and his pregnant wife is kissed goodbye by him, still in love.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Sandra checks the mail, hoping for a letter from Edward, when a black car arrives, and two army officers exit, bringing news that makes Sandra cry. Later, she hangs sheets to dry, forming a tunnel of fabric, and sees a shadow ripple. She freezes, knowing it can't be Edward—he's dead—but hangs the dress anyway. Looking up again, she finds Edward before her and gasps in disbelief, but his hand is real, and she kisses him without hesitation. Under the covers, a man's hand traces a woman's back; she turns over in bed to see Will watching her. Edward is startled as both women quickly gather plates. Will and Edward smile, knowing the women desire this. Edward looks away, angry and disbelieving, as Will cleans leaves from the pool overgrown with algae. A sudden ripple startles Will, who drops the pole and is relieved no one saw. Sandra, Will, and Josephine stare into a storeroom filled with unfinished projects, old products Edward sold, a roll-top desk, and file cabinets. Sandra makes a sound of memory while examining a file and hands Will a shocking yellowed telegram. Sandra stands as Josephine kisses Will before following her; he re-reads the telegram in disbelief and tucks it into a mechanical hand, which clamps down on it. The camera focuses on the telegram as Edward's voice begins as a memory, where on a platform, Edward pitches a new product to a crowd and kisses his pregnant wife goodbye, still in love.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Sandra checks the mail for Edward's letter when a black car arrives with two army officers, bringing her to tears. Later, while hanging sheets, she sees a shadow on the fabric, knowing it can't be Edward—he's dead. Yet, Edward is before her, and she kisses him. In bed, a man's hand traces a woman's back; she wakes to Will watching. Edward is startled as both women gather plates, exchanging smiles with Will. Edward looks away angrily as Will cleans the algae-filled pool, dropping the pole in surprise. Sandra, Will, and Josephine discover a storeroom with Edward's unfinished projects. Sandra finds a telegram that shocks Will, who tucks it into a mechanical hand clamp. The camera focuses on the telegram while Edward's voice narrates a memory of him pitching a product and kissing his pregnant wife.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Sandra, in her usual morning routine, diligently checks the mail, holding onto a sliver of hope for a letter from Edward. Her heart skips a beat when a sleek, black car suddenly pulls up to the curb. Two imposing army officers step out, delivering news that causes Sandra to cry out in anguish. Later, with heavy emotions lingering, Sandra takes to hanging sheets out to dry, forming a long, billowing tunnel of crisp white fabric. As she reaches into the basket to pull out a dress, she glances upwards and notices a mysterious, shadowy ripple crossing the fabric's surface. She freezes momentarily, her mind rejecting the impossible thought—it cannot be Edward, for he is no longer alive. Resolutely, she turns away but continues her task, hanging the dress and reaching for another garment. When she looks up again, Edward himself appears before her eyes, a ghostly figure that seems too real to believe. She gasps, caught in disbelief, but his hand's solid warmth is undeniable, and so, without any hesitation, she kisses him passionately.

Elsewhere, beneath the soft covers, a man's hand gently traces the delicate curves of a woman's back. She stirs and turns over in bed, waking up to find Will watching her with tender affection. Edward is shocked as both women hurriedly start gathering plates, a flurry of activity that doesn't go unnoticed. Will and Edward exchange smiles, understanding that the women desire this moment to unfold in its entirety. However, Edward’s expression shifts to one of anger and disbelief as he averts his gaze. Meanwhile, Will is busy cleaning leaves from the pool, whose surface is now overgrown with a layer of algae and slime. A sudden, unexpected ripple under the water startles him, causing him to drop the pole with a splash. He looks around quickly, relieved that no one witnessed his moment of clumsiness.

Inside, the scene transitions as the doors swing open to reveal Sandra, Will, and Josephine, all standing in front of a cluttered storeroom. It is packed with unfinished projects, remnants of old products that Edward once sold, and pieces of furniture like a roll-top desk accompanied by metal file cabinets. Sandra lets out a nostalgic sound as she sifts through a pile of old files, eventually handing Will a yellowed telegram that stuns him into silence. As Sandra stands, Josephine tenderly kisses Will before following Sandra out. Will, still reeling from the shock, re-reads the telegram, his expression full of disbelief. Searching for a suitable place to set it down, he opts to tuck it into a mechanical hand perched on the desk, which unexpectedly clamps down on the paper. As the camera gradually zooms in on the telegram, the scene transitions into a vivid memory, with Edward's voice resonating in the background. On a busy platform, Edward enthusiastically pitches a new product to an eager crowd, sharing a loving goodbye kiss with his pregnant wife, enveloped in an undying love.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
In her usual morning routine steeped in a sense of familiarity, Sandra conscientiously checks the mail. She clutches onto a glimmer of hope, secretly wishing for the arrival of a letter from Edward. Her heart leaps in anticipation when a sleek, black car suddenly glides up to the curb. From this vehicle, two imposing army officers emerge, bearing news that shatters her composure, causing Sandra to cry out in profound anguish. Later, with heavy emotions still pressing down on her spirit, Sandra busies herself by hanging sheets out to dry, creating a long, billowing tunnel of crisp white fabric between herself and the world. As she reaches into the basket to pull out a dress, she looks up and notices a mysterious, shadowy ripple moving across the fabric's surface. For a moment, she is frozen, her mind adamantly rejecting the very notion of the impossible—it simply cannot be Edward, for he is no longer among the living. Determinedly, she turns away and continues with her task, hanging the dress and reaching for yet another garment. When she lifts her eyes once more, Edward himself appears before her, a ghostly figure that seems too real for her to believe. She gasps, captured in astonishment, but the undeniable warmth of his hand is tangible, and thus, with no hesitation, she kisses him passionately.

In another part of their lives, beneath the soft, inviting covers, a man's hand tenderly traces the delicate curves of a woman's back. She stirs slightly and turns over in bed, waking up to find Will observing her with tender, affectionate eyes. Meanwhile, Edward stands shocked as both women hurriedly start gathering plates, setting off a flurry of activity that doesn't escape notice. Will and Edward exchange knowing smiles, an understanding passing between them, recognizing that the women wish for this moment to fully unfold. However, Edward’s expression shifts abruptly to one of anger and disbelief as he diverts his gaze. Meanwhile, Will focuses on cleaning leaves from the pool, whose surface is now overtaken by a layer of algae and slime. A sudden, unforeseen ripple beneath the water startles him, causing him to drop the pole with a loud splash. He quickly glances around, relieved that no one was there to witness his moment of clumsiness.

Inside the house, the scene transitions as the doors swing open, revealing Sandra, Will, and Josephine, all standing before a cluttered storeroom. It is cramped with unfinished projects, remnants of old products once sold by Edward, and pieces of furniture such as a roll-top desk flanked by metal file cabinets. Sandra emits a nostalgic sound as she sifts through a pile of old files, eventually handing Will a yellowed telegram that renders him momentarily speechless. As Sandra stands, Josephine lovingly kisses Will before following Sandra out. Will, still grappling with shock, reads the telegram again, his face reflecting disbelief. Searching for an appropriate place to set it down, he decides to tuck it into a mechanical hand perched on the desk, which unexpectedly clamps down on the paper. As the camera's focus gradually zooms in on the telegram, the scene transforms into a vivid memory with Edward's voice resonating in the background. On a bustling platform, Edward enthusiastically pitches a new product to an eager crowd, sharing a loving goodbye kiss with his pregnant wife, encapsulated in an unwavering love.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Sandra steps outside to check the mail, she feels a flutter of hope, eagerly anticipating a letter from Edward. Her heart races when she spots a black car slowly pulling up to her driveway. She watches intently as two army officers step out, their somber expressions sending a wave of dread crashing over her. The moment she hears them deliver the tragic news, a cry escapes her lips, her emotions overwhelming her. Later, in a bid to distract herself, Sandra methodically hangs sheets on the line to dry, creating a tunnel-like pathway through the soft, billowing fabric. Each sheet is carefully secured, and as she bends down to pull a dress from the basket, a flicker of movement catches her eye. She pauses, peering up to see a shadow gently rippling across the pristine white cloth. Her heart skips a beat and she is momentarily paralyzed, the implications clear in her mind—it cannot possibly be him, for she knows Edward is gone. With a heavy heart, she turns away, yet her resolve strengthens as she resumes her task, deliberately hanging the dress and reaching for another item. When she glances up again, her breath catches in her throat—there stands Edward, seemingly alive and whole before her. Her mind reels in disbelief, but his hand reaches out, solid and real. Overcome with a rush of emotion, she doesn't hesitate to kiss him, accepting the impossible reality. In the intimacy of their bed, a man's hand tenderly traces the curves of a woman's back, moments before she rolls over, awakening to find Will gazing at her. Meanwhile, Edward is taken aback as the two women, acting with urgency, skillfully gather plates. A shared understanding passes between Will and Edward, their smiles betraying their contentment with this moment. However, a flicker of anger and disbelief clouds Edward's expression as he diverts his gaze, observing Will as he diligently attempts to clear leaves from the pool, which has become a dense, green quagmire of algae and slime. As Will maneuvers the pole with care, a sudden ripple beneath the water surface startles him, causing the pole to slip from his grasp and splash into the water. He quickly looks around, relieved to find no witnesses to his blunder. Moments later, the doors swing open, revealing Sandra, Will, and Josephine as they peer into a storeroom teeming with the remnants of Edward's past ventures—unfinished projects piled haphazardly, forgotten products he once sold, a roll-top desk reigning over the clutter, and metal file cabinets standing guard. As Sandra rifles through a file, a sound of recognition escapes her, sparking a memory. She passes a yellowed telegram to Will, whose eyes widen in shock upon reading its contents. Rising from her seat, Sandra moves gracefully as Josephine leans in to kiss Will before trailing after her mother. Will remains, his mind racing as he rereads the telegram, unable to fully grasp its implications. Searching for a suitable place to set it, he opts to tuck it into the grip of a mechanical hand on the desk, which clamps down with finality. The camera tightens its focus on the telegram just as Edward's voice emerges from the past, his presence vivid in memory. On a platform, Edward confidently pitches a new product to an attentive crowd, turning to kiss his pregnant wife goodbye, their love still shining brightly.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Sandra checks the mail, hoping for a letter from Edward, when a black car arrives with two army officers who deliver news that makes her cry out. Later, she is hanging sheets to dry when she notices a shadow across the fabric and, despite knowing it can't be him, she turns away in disbelief. As she continues hanging clothes, she looks up to find Edward standing before her, and after an initial gasp, she kisses him, realizing it's really him. In bed, a man's hand caresses a woman's back. She wakes to Will watching her, while Edward is surprised as both women gather plates, and he and Will exchange knowing smiles about the situation the women desire. Edward looks away, upset while Will cleans the algae-covered pool, startled by a ripple that makes him drop the pole, relieved no one saw. Sandra, Will, and Josephine then explore a storeroom filled with Edward's unfinished projects and old products. Sandra reacts to a memory as she hands Will a yellowed telegram that shocks him. After Josephine kisses Will and leaves with Sandra, he re-reads the telegram in disbelief and places it in a mechanical hand on the desk, which clamps down on it. The camera focuses on the telegram as Edward's voice emerges in a memory, recalling how he once presented a new product to a crowd and lovingly kissed his pregnant wife goodbye.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Sandra checks the mail, hoping for a letter from Edward, a soldier stationed overseas during a tumultuous conflict, when a black car pulls up and two army officers, typically bearers of grave news, get out, causing Sandra to cry out upon hearing the devastating news. Later, Sandra hangs sheets to dry, forming a tunnel of fabric in the backyard where she often found solace, and as she pulls a dress from the basket, she looks up and sees a shadow ripple across the white fabric. She freezes, knowing it can't be him—he's dead according to the official telegram—and turns away, but with determination, she hangs the dress and retrieves another, fueled by her resilient spirit. Looking up again, she sees Edward himself standing before her, miraculously alive and defying all logic, and gasps in disbelief, but his hand is real, so she kisses him without hesitation, overwhelmed with joy and relief. Under the covers, a man's hand traces the curves of a woman's back, then she turns over in bed, waking up to Will watching her, his eyes filled with contentment. Edward is startled as both women, who have become accustomed to sharing their lives in his absence, quickly gather plates, and Will and Edward smile, knowing the women want this reunion to happen. Edward looks away, angry and disbelieving at the state of his former life, as Will cleans leaves from the pool, but the pool, neglected over time, is overgrown with algae and slime. A sudden underwater ripple startles Will, who drops the pole into the water and looks around, relieved no one saw, though still unnerved. The doors open to reveal Sandra, Will, and Josephine staring into a storeroom, filled with unfinished projects, remnants of Edward’s once-thriving business, old products Edward sold, a roll-top desk, and metal file cabinets. Sandra makes a sound of memory while looking through a file and hands Will a yellowed telegram, which shocks him with its once-final words. Sandra stands and Josephine kisses Will before following her, while he re-reads the telegram in disbelief. Searching for a place to set it, he tucks it into a mechanical hand on the desk, a relic of Edward's inventive past, which clamps down on it. The camera pushes in on the telegram as Edward's voice begins as a memory, where on a platform during a product launch Edward pitches a new product to a crowd, showcasing his entrepreneurial spirit, and kisses his pregnant wife goodbye, still in love with both his family and dreams.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. no one saw. The doors open to reveal Sandra. Sandra stands and Josephine kisses Will before following her while he rereads the telegram in disbelief. Searching for a place to set it he tucks it into a mechanical hand on the desk which clamps down on it. The camera pushes in on the telegram as Edward's voice begins as a memory where on a platform Edward pitches a new product to a crowd and kisses his pregnant wife. goodbye still in love.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Luna examines the garden, hoping for a postcard from Derek, when a red bicycle rolls by and two chefs hop off, prompting Luna to laugh aloud upon receiving the gift. Later, Luna strings lights to flicker, creating a corridor of illumination, and as she pulls a scarf from the crate, she glances up and notices a bird flitting across the blue sky. She pauses, knowing it can't be Rex—he's missing—and pivots away, but with resolve, she strings the scarf and gathers another. Looking up once more, she sees Derek himself standing near her, and gasps in astonishment, but his smile is tangible, so she embraces him without delay. Beneath the blankets, a cat’s tail sways over a child's foot, then he turns over on the rug, waking up to Molly cheering him. Derek is puzzled as both children hurriedly arrange toys, and Molly and Derek laugh, understanding the children invited this. Derek glances aside, frustrated and perplexed, as Molly collects feathers from the fountain, but the fountain is cluttered with petals and dust. A sudden surface shimmer surprises Molly, who drops the net into the fountain and peers around, relieved no one noticed. The windows swing open to present Luna, Molly, and Benjamin gazing into a workshop, filled with incomplete inventions, old tools Derek crafted, a sewing machine, and wooden storage boxes. Luna makes a sound of recognition while handling a journal and hands Molly a crumpled postcard, which amazes her. Luna rises and Benjamin hugs Molly before tailing her, while she re-reads the postcard in uncertainty. Searching for a spot to place it, she slides it into a robotic claw on the table, which grips it tightly. The lens zooms in on the postcard as Derek's voice begins as a recollection, where on a stage Derek demonstrates an old gadget to an audience and hugs his expectant partner goodbye, still adoring.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Sandra anxiously awaits a letter from Edward when two army officers deliver distressing news, causing her to cry. Later, as Sandra hangs laundry, she sees a shadow she assumes can't be Edward, but then he appears, and she embraces him. In bed, she wakes to find Will beside her, sharing a smile with Edward, who appears upset while cleaning the overgrown pool. A ripple startles Will, but he regains composure. Sandra and Josephine show Will a storeroom with Edward's unfinished projects. Sandra hands Will a shocking telegram, leaving him in disbelief. He places it in a mechanical hand, which clamps down on it, while Edward's voice recalls pitching a product and kissing his pregnant wife goodbye.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: goodbye still in love The camera pushes in on the telegram as Edward's voice begins as a memory where on a platform Edward pitches a new product to a crowd and kisses his pregnant wife Searching for a place to set it he tucks it into a mechanical hand on the desk which clamps down on it Sandra stands and Josephine kisses Will before following her while he rereads the telegram in disbelief Sandra makes a sound of memory while looking through a file and hands Will a yellowed telegram which shocks him Edward sold a rolltop desk and metal file cabinets Will and Josephine staring into a storeroom filled with unfinished projects old products The doors open to reveal Sandra no one saw A sudden underwater ripple startles Will who drops the pole into the water and looks around relieved Edward looks away angry and disbelieving as Will cleans leaves from the pool but the pool is overgrown with algae and slime Edward is startled as both women quickly gather plates and Will and Edward smile knowing the women want this to happen then she turns over in bed waking up to Will watching her Under the covers a man's hand traces the curves of a woman's back Looking up again she sees Edward himself standing before her and gasps in disbelief but his hand is real so she kisses him without hesitation She freezes knowing it cannot be him—he is dead—and turns away but with determination she hangs the dress and retrieves another Later Sandra hangs sheets to dry forming a tunnel of fabric and as she pulls a dress from the basket she looks up and sees a shadow ripple across the white fabric Sandra checks the mail hoping for a letter from Edward when a black car pulls up and two army officers get out causing Sandra to cry out upon hearing the news
